}} The 'NES Advantage' is an arcade style controller released by Nintendo for
the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1987. The device is meant to rest on a flat
surface at a comfortable level, such as a tabletop or the floor, with the player
seated behind it. This way, it could be used like an arcade game joystickâwith
the left hand using the joystick and the right hand operating the buttons.
